intro: Pseudosmelia, commonly known as the false sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. They are adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Pseudosmelia species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
